subject: Real Estate
title: Alaska: Seward's Folly
description: Learn Alaska: Seward's Folly in one minute.

hook.text: In 1867, Secretary of State William Seward bought Alaska from Russia for $7.2 million. America laughed at him.

buildup.text: Newspapers called it 'Seward's Folly' and 'Seward's Icebox.' Why pay for a frozen wasteland?

discovery.text: Alaska turned out to hold massive reserves of gold, oil, timber, and fisheries worth trillions.

twist.text: At 2 cents per acre, Alaska's purchase price was less than the annual oil revenue it generates today.

climax.text: Seward never lived to see his vindication, but his 'folly' became one of the smartest deals in history.

punchline.text: The 'folly' turned out to be worth trillions.

quiz.question: Why was the Alaska purchase initially mocked?
options: People considered it a frozen wasteland
